title: How to Make Weight Watchers Cabbage Soup

steps.headline: In a small saucepan, bring 3/4 cup water to a boil; add rice.
steps.description: Reduce High temperature to low temperature; simmer, covered, 12-15 minutes, until rice is tender and all liquid is absorbed. Remove from heat; set aside.

steps.headline: In a big saucepan or Dutch oven, heat oil; add garlic.
steps.description: Cook over medium-high heat, stirring all the time, 1 minute, until fragrant.

steps.headline: Stir in carrot and bell pepper; cook, stirring oftentimes, 5 min, until peppers are softened.
Add cabbage and sugar; cook, stirring frequently, four minutes, until cabbage is softened.
Add tomatoes, beans, salt and 2 1/2 cups water to vegetable mixture; bring liquid to a boil.
steps.description: Stir in cooked rice; return liquid to a boil. Reduce heat to low temperature; simmer, stirring occasionally, 5 min, until mixture is heated through and flavors are blended.

steps.headline: Divide cabbage mixture among  soup bowls; top each portion with 1 1/2 teaspoons sour cream.

text: In a small saucepan, bring 3/4 cup water to a boil; add rice. Reduce High temperature to low temperature; simmer, covered, 12-15 minutes, until rice is tender and all liquid is absorbed. Remove from heat; set aside. In a big saucepan or Dutch oven, heat oil; add garlic. Cook over medium-high heat, stirring all the time, 1 minute, until fragrant. Stir in carrot and bell pepper; cook, stirring oftentimes, 5 min, until peppers are softened.  Add cabbage and sugar; cook, stirring frequently, four minutes, until cabbage is softened.  Add tomatoes, beans, salt and 2 1/2 cups water to vegetable mixture; bring liquid to a boil. Stir in cooked rice; return liquid to a boil. Reduce heat to low temperature; simmer, stirring occasionally, 5 min, until mixture is heated through and flavors are blended. Stir in dill and vinegar.  Divide cabbage mixture among  soup bowls; top each portion with 1 1/2 teaspoons sour cream.  Finished.
